description: 'Robinson Bungalows requires a full prepayment with  Paypal' Robinson Bungalows is unplug from the noisy world and escape to a deserted sunset beach. Our bungalows are made from wood with straw roofs and double beds with a mosquito net for your comfort. There are lights in the room and on the terrace and nicely located hammocks to relax and soak up the sea views. Robinson Bungalows is completely off the grid. We use 100% solar panels for energy and store rain water for washing. Come and enjoy the luxury of simple life. Enjoy a nap in your seaside hammock, listen to the birds sing, swim through the colorful coral and stare eye to eye with a parrot fish. If you are looking for adventure, you can take a dive course next door or explore the beautiful jungle of Koh Rong Samloem. The Lazy Beach Boat brings you directly to Robinson Bungalows without trekking through the jungle. You can book your boat ticket with josh@lazybeachcambodia.com (please us this email only for boat bookings, for all other questions please send a email to info@robinsonbungalows.com or messenger from your booking channel). Please arrive 1/2 an hour before departure in the Lazy Beach Office. The boat leaves at 1pm each day. The  boat is not waiting for any delay, and you have to take a speed boat to the island. You can buy tickets at any travel agency or at lazy beach office. The Lazy Beach Booking Office is situated on Serendipity Beach Road at The Dive Shop Cambodia Office. It is easy to find by using Google Maps and searching for The Dive Shop. The ride to and from the island takes ~2 hours.  The way back to Sihanoukville the boat leaves 8.30 from Robinson Bungalows. Whenever possible you arrive at Ochheuteal Beach in Sihanoukville. The boat cost $10-per-person and one way. If your bus is late or any other problem by later arriving send an e-mail to josh@lazybeachcambodia.com Due windy and wavy conditions (most between may-september) the boat will arrive and leave Saracen Bay on Koh Rong Samloem. Our remote beach is NOT operated by any of the speedferry companies. Only a few companies stop at the jetty closest to our path, BuvaSea and G.T.V.C.. Please book your ticket with your guesthouse in Cambodia, any travel agency, the ferry offices in town or online. Your destination port on the island will be Saracen Bay, from where you will start a ~35 minute jungle trek to Sunset Beach. You’ll find the beginning of the trail right behind the dive shop. If you bring some mosquito repellent, a bottle of water and proper shoes you are perfectly prepared for a fun jungle trek. Maybe you even wanna make your life a bit easier and leave your big bags with your guesthouse or a travel agency on the mainland.  View House Rules

description: Eighty8 Backpackers hostel is an oasis within the heart of a bustling Phnom Penh with a swimming pool for that much needed cooling dip. There is even a KFC and a Starbucks nearby for those missing a taste from home, along with four of the city’s top restaurants within easy walking. Our dormitory rooms come with big personal lockers and en-suite shared bathroom facilities and each bed has USB charger socket and reading light. A recent addition to the hostel are the new sleeping pods, a dormitory style room with private sleeping pods & lockers with shared private en-suite bathroom cubicles. All pods come with reading light, USB charger sockets, fans and room AC. Eighty8 has a large common area with a big screen for sports and events along with a Restaurant (open 7am to 10pm) & Bar (open 7am to 12am) serving both Khmer and western delights along with cold Cambodia beers and fab cocktails. description: Welcome to Coast 23 Hostel & Bar, a community driven hideaway on one of Cambodia's most beautiful and untouched islands. Ideally situated on the edge of 'M'Pai Bay' fishing village and the unspoiled and famous 'Plankton Beach', Coast 23 offers its guests a true island retreat. From sipping cocktails whilst lounging in your hammock with your favourite book in hand, to enjoying and meeting new, like minded travellers during one of our many happy hours, you're sure to find something which makes you stay that one extra day! The island of Koh Rong Samloem is just a short hop on one of the multiple speed ferry routes from the mainland of Sihanoukville or our big brother of an island, Koh Rong. Coast 23 Hostel offers clean, comfortable and affordable community living on a true paradise island. Inbetween relaxing or exploring, Mama and the rest of the Coast 23 family is here to cater to all your culinary needs, providing both local and western infused delights to suit every palette. A range of activities are possible on the island of Koh Rong Samloem, these include; jungle trekking, scuba-diving, day and night fishing trips, kayaking and much, much more, which can be organised through any one of our friendly staff members. description: The Hornbill is a comfy hangout with espresso coffee, books and boardgames. There are plenty of spaces to chill including an array of seats, sofas, swings, decking area and garden where you can read, write or watch everyday Cambodian life pass by. We have a cinema space for 10 guests which plays movies and documentaries most nights. In the day its a chill space to play games, have a nap or do some yoga. Our cafe is open early serving real coffee, breakfast, baked goods, home made snacks, cocktails and family dinner. All our rooms are clean and simple. Upstairs we have a 6 bed and 8 bed dorm and 4 private rooms.  All beds have a net and fan and the rooms have shelves and charging stations. Private rooms have towels and dorm guests will be asked for $1 if one is required.. We do not have individual lockers in rooms but we offer all guests secure storage. Our guests can also enjoy the balcony space which has a large sofa and bar top with a jungle view. For the rainy days there is a Mini-SNES console and PS4 with lots of different games. The bathrooms are shared facilities. And our newest addition; The Hornbill House. description: Situated in a prime position on the beautiful M’Pay Bay area of Koh Rong Sanleom, guests are just minutes from the stunning beaches and crystal clear water that surrounds the island. Whether you have come to relax or party at Yellow Moon you have the option to do both! Chill out in our hammocks and tree houses through the day then at night enjoy a drink at our fully loaded beach bar where we have a bonfire and fire show every night as well as beer pong, live music nights and themed nights ( and of course numerous happy hours running through the night including buy 1 get 1 free buckets or spirite !) One of the  key attractions at The Yellow Moon is that we are situated right on the famous plankton beach, simply wait till its dark, splash about in the water and let the magic happen! Being on an island there are a number of water activities to do. Every day we run a boat trip which takes you to the local reefs for snorkeling and swimming, guests can then fish Khmer style before finishing the day watching the sunset whilst heading back for a BBQ. All equipment is provided. We also have a dive shop on the premises offering a number of dive packages with our fully qualified instructors.  Top tip before coming to the island! There are no ATMs here and no way to process card transactions, so remember to bring enough cash for your stay. Cambodian ATMs issue $100 dollar bills, getting this changed before you arrive will be a great help to the hostel and local businesses. The best way to reach us from the mainland is by using a boat company called GTVC at Sihanoukville pier. They run a regular service to M'Pai Bay (where we are on Koh Rong Samleom.) Times are: 08;00, 11;00, 14:00, 16:00. We recommend waiting until you get the pier before buying your ticket. We also sell return tickets here at  the hostel. TOP TIP- Do not get off the boat anywhere other than M' Pai Bay.  View House Rules

description: Welcome to Beach Park Hostel & Tree Bar on the idyllic island of Koh Rong Samloem. We are situated centrally on Saracen Bay, a location infamous for its white sandy beaches and transparent waters. The Hostel offers spectacular views of the Saracen Bay inlet; consequently, having a drink at Tree Bar will provide a memorable experience that you won’t forget in a hurry. The Hostel provides varying levels of accommodation including: 3 Double Bed Private Bungalows (Elm, Oak, & Pine), 1 Twin Bed Private Bungalow (Maple), 5 (4 Mixed Gender/ 1 Female Only) Air Conditioned Single Bed Dorms (12 Beds Per Dorm) & 2 Fan Single Bed Dorms (8 Beds Per Dorm) ensuring that we are able to meet the requirements of all our potential customers. Beach Park Hostel offers a number of activities including Tree Bar’s Kayak Challenge, Luminescent Plankton Tours, Snorkeling /Fishing Trips & Daily Volleyball Tournaments. For those wanting to embrace the natural beauty of the island why not try the plethora of walks the island has to offer, we assure you that you will not be disappointed. The resort has developed a reputation as the ‘go to location’ for the islands night entertainment, providing mesmerizing nightly fire-shows, live music and the perfect atmosphere to socialize and cultivate those lifelong friendships, which we all travel for. We are highly accessible from the mainland of Shianoukville with speed ferries running very frequently; although speed ferry tickets can be purchased from Occhueteal pier, we advise that you purchase your tickets online to avoid any disappointment. Upon arrival from Shianoukville to Koh Rong Samloem Beach Park Hostel & Tree Bar is approximately a 5-minute walk from Orchid Pier; be sure to ask for a free slice of watermelon upon your arrival. Here at Beach Park Hostel, we understand the importance of your future plans and staying in contact with those who are not with us on our travels. The hostel provides free WiFi for our valued customers, please ask a member of staff for the password upon arrival. We look forward to welcoming you with open arms…. description: Welcome to Koh Rong Samloem’s premier hostel and private beach resort. If you are searching for the perfect island experience, Mad Monkey could just be your perfect destination. Lounge in our ocean hammocks under the sun during the day and enjoy our nightly events with over 100 other travelers from around the world. Mad Monkey is located on its own private bay with golden sands and azure blue waters. Our bay can only be reached by boat. To book tickets, inquire at any Mad Monkey or visit the Speed Ferry Booking Office near the Golden Lions Roundabout in Sihanoukville. The office is open everyday from 8am until 6pm. The Speed Ferry will bring you to Saracen Bay, then you will transfer boats and a complimentary Mad Monkey long tail boat will bring you to the hostel. We have beachfront en-suite bungalows overlooking the private bay, shared dorm rooms with a separate shower, and a large bar and social area. Mad Monkey is a party hostel with a relaxed atmosphere, best suited to younger guests and independent travellers that want to meet other people. We are also a socially responsible business, so your stay with us benefits sustainable development projects in the local community. With a fully packed funky events schedule, activities, a friendly vibe, and excellent customer service, you would be mad to book anywhere else! IMPORTANT INFO: *Free Pickup from Orchid Pier at 10 am, 12:30 pm, and 4 pm OR when the Speed Ferry arrives.
